com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.plan

Class DeploymentStep

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.DefaultObservable
      • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.plan.AbstractStep
        • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.plan.DeploymentStep
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable, Element, Interruptible, Step
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultRecoveryStep

    public class DeploymentStep
extends AbstractStep
    Step which implements the deployment of a pod.

      • start

        public java.util.Optional<PodInstanceRequirement> start()
        Description copied from interface: Step
        Starts the Step, whose Status should be Status.PENDING. Returns an OfferRequirement, or an empty Optional if obtaining/updating resource requirements are not applicable to the Step. This will continue to be called for as long as Element.isPending() returns true.
        See Also:
        #updateOfferStatus(Collection)} which returns the outcome of the {@link OfferRequirement}

      • updateOfferStatus

        public void updateOfferStatus(java.util.Collection<OfferRecommendation> recommendations)
        Description copied from interface: Step
        Notifies the Step whether the PodInstanceRequirement previously returned by Step.start() has been successfully accepted/fulfilled. The recommendations param is empty when no offers matching the requirement previously returned by Step.start() could be found. This is only called if Step.start() returned a non-empty PodInstanceRequirement.

      • getAsset

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getAsset()
        Description copied from interface: Step
        Return the Asset that this Step intends to work on.
        Returns:
        The name of the Asset this Step intends to work on if one exists, Optional.empty() otherwise.
